org.spongepowered.api.service.event

Interface EventManager


  • public interface EventManager
    Manages the registration of event handlers and the dispatching of events.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean post(Event event)
      Calls a Event to all handlers that handle it.
      <T extends Event>
      void      		 register(Object plugin, Class<T> eventClass, EventHandler<? super T> handler)
      Registers an event handler for a specific event class.
      <T extends Event>
      void      		 register(Object plugin, Class<T> eventClass, Order order, EventHandler<? super T> handler)
      Registers an event handler with the specified order for a specific event class.
      void register(Object plugin, Object obj)
      Registers Event methods annotated with @Subscribe in the specified object.
      void unregister(Object obj)
      Un-registers an object from receiving Events.
      void unregisterPlugin(Object plugin)
      Un-registers all event handlers of a plugin.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        void register(Object plugin,
              Object obj)
        Registers Event methods annotated with @Subscribe in the specified object.

        Only methods that are public will be registered and the class must be public as well.

        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin instance
        obj - The object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if plugin is not a plugin instance

      • register

        <T extends Event> void register(Object plugin,
                                Class<T> eventClass,
                                EventHandler<? super T> handler)
        Registers an event handler for a specific event class.

        Normally, the annotation-based way in register(Object, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the event
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin instance
        eventClass - The event to listen to
        handler - The handler to receive the events

      • register

        <T extends Event> void register(Object plugin,
                                Class<T> eventClass,
                                Order order,
                                EventHandler<? super T> handler)
        Registers an event handler with the specified order for a specific event class.

        Normally, the annotation-based way in register(Object, Object) should be preferred over this way. This method exists primarily to support dynamic event registration like needed in scripting plugins.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the event
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin instance
        eventClass - The event to listen to
        order - The order the handler will get called at
        handler - The handler to receive the events

      • unregister

        void unregister(Object obj)
        Un-registers an object from receiving Events.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object

      • unregisterPlugin

        void unregisterPlugin(Object plugin)
        Un-registers all event handlers of a plugin.
        Parameters:
        plugin - The plugin instance

      • post

        boolean post(Event event)
        Calls a Event to all handlers that handle it.
        Parameters:
        event - The event
        Returns:
        True if cancelled, false if not
